meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>lunatic</kanji> or <kanji>crazy</kanji>. The verb version of this is <vocabulary>to go mad</vocabulary> (you don't really "go lunatic" now, do you?) or <vocabulary>to go crazy</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: To remember the reading, just think about how when you go crazy, you are <reading>coming</reading> (来る) to crazy town. Just imagine some voice beckoning you to come. Come here! Please come here! Come to crazy town! Give in to the voices!
